intro: Zygocarpum yemenense, commonly known as the Yemen starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Yemen and parts of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, and is characterized by its vine-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by fruits resembling small, star-shaped tomatoes. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the fruit has a tart, acidic flavor. Zygocarpum yemenense is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or semi-desert areas.
